intro: Draba cauquenensis, commonly known as the Cauquen sandflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and low-growing habit, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Draba cauquenensis typically blooms in the spring and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
